nodes.name: Set

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
## Real-time listening and processing of search results with Icypeas.

‍

This workflow, with the webhook, allows you to retrieve the results of your searches with Icypeas ({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} and redirect them wherever you want.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## Link your Icypeas account with a webhook



The first node, « Webhook », is a webhook that needs to be referenced in the Icypeas application under the API section of the user’s profile (see documentation here : {{ $env.API_BASE_URL }}



‍







You need to copy the Test URL (don't forget to change it to the production URL before you active the workflow) provided by n8n when clicking on the node. 

Then go to the user profile in the Icypeas application ({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} After logging in, click on the profile icon > Select Your Profile > Go to the API section > Click on the Enable API Access button, and enter the URL in the field "Notification when each row is treated during a bulk search".

Save the notification routes.

The webhook will be called by our system whenever a new result is available.

This allows for real-time notification of new results as they become available. 


**Be careful** : this template only works for email searches and domain scans. An adaptation for email verification will be made very soon.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
## Retrieve the relevant informations



Finally, the « Set » node allows you to retrieve the relevant information from the search: name / first name / email.














For your information, you can manipulate this webhook as you want. For example, you can add an additional node to redirect the responses to the service of your choice, like Lemlist ({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} Simply click on the “+” and create a lead on Lemlist

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Webhook Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Webhook Workflow. This workflow integrates 4 different services: webhook, stickyNote, set, stopAndError. It contains 7 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 7
- **Node Types**: 4
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Webhook**: webhook
- **Set**: set
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Error Handler**: stopAndError
- **Error Handler for 23dc1873**: stopAndError

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
